name: Jumeirah Beach Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights from 29th May and chose the premium leisure option, with half board.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for families

reviews.text: The premium leisure lounge had soft drinks all day, and snacks and food most of the day. The food was brilliant and we didn't need lunch most days. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere was very relaxed. There was a large kids area, so the main lounge was calm. The best thing was that the wild wadi entrance was a few steps from the terrace here, so you could have a coffee and pop into the water park so easily. It was really easy with the children.
reviews.title: Ocean Club Exec Rooms Made The Stay.
Almost As Good As Expected
reviews.text: The restaurants were good - Beachcombers is a buffet overlooking the Burj and the food was fantastic. I don't like buffets as I prefer to be served, but we went twice as the food was so good. Grilled lobster, steak, squid - and thai food too.
Overall, we preferred here to the Atlantis as it was so easy for popping to the water park, beach and pool.
reviews.title: Destination Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one complaint was that the lifts were often full and slow but really it wasn't a problem. The beach was brilliant - the kids loved the waves and there was a nice breeze.
reviews.title: Butlins Meets Only Way is Essex.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again what can I say..... I cannot fault this hotel from start to finish. Our car was waiting for us when we arrived off of our flight straight to the hotel and checked in at the premium leisure while we had breakfast and were told our room was ready. By 9.30 we were by the pool and in the sun.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: This must have been our 6/7 time at the hotel I cannot remember but we would not go to any other as no other match up and we have been to Dubai about 14 times now.
reviews.title: Breathtaking

reviews.text: It is nice to be meet by people who do remember us and this time we came without our daughter and every member of staff who new us asked after her.
reviews.title: It just gets better and better ......

reviews.text: We could not fault any member of staff but we think of Patrick and earl at the executive pool as really good friends and they made our holiday special. But we could not forget kavindra at the exec pool and of course Albert and Charles at the prem lounge and not forgetting Robert who always had our drinks ready.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in an amazing place

reviews.text: We think of this hotel as our second home and cannot wait to return next May/June.
reviews.title: Perfect... Excellent... Best in Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: having just returned from the Jumeirah Beach Hotel my wife and I wish to express our sincere thanks to all the staff, buggy drivers, room guys etc for a superb stay. Everyone was so helpful and charming. A superb resort and a first class hotel. I cannot find any faults with any aspect. I hope this goes directly to the hotel management and directors. It is a wonderful place and I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: What a great hotel.

reviews.text: Robin and Barbara Brooks. Maidstone. Kent UK.
reviews.title: Stellar hotel

reviews.text: Loved this hotel. Service was absolutely amazing - probably best I've ever seen anywhere (although I have not stayed at the Burj Al Arab). Brunch was spectacular, food extremely good. Next door water park was actually a very nice addition and allowed you to feel that you could move from one part of the hotel to a completely different experience (I went 1/2 the days I was there). Balcony views were fantastic (definitely worth the additional money in my mind). Hotel room decor was definitely a bit tacky though and the only place the service wasn't top notch was the front desk for issues related to bill payments or resolving small fee questions/disputes. For instance, if I remember correctly, at one point I wanted to upgrade a room and the front desk didn't seem willing to give me the price I could get from their own website upstairs in the business center or which had been available online the day before. Sure, they had a right to do this, but it's not typical of what one expects from a top notch American hotel, for instance (where they seem more gracious about small financial issues when they are looking at your overall experience). The matter was resolved to my satisfaction after speaking with a manager, but I did see others having some discussions with the front desk about billing issues (e.g., meals) - completely at odds with everything else about this hotel. Don't get me wrong - if I was in Dubai again, I would absolutely come here again and I felt that the overall experience was fantastic. I guess my caution above is more along the lines of "don't get bent out of shape if you have a small issue like this, it happens, they aren't perfect in this category yet" (and pls note my five star rating!). Outstanding gym and exercise facilities. Surprisingly, good Italian food too! Beach was very nice with excellent view, but perhaps since I'm not European, I don't love the idea of boats floating around anywhere near the swimming area (although it didn't seem to affect the cleanliness of the water, which was my concern!).
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the Jumeria Beach hotel! especially for the beach! Great service, awesome restaraunts, fun kidsclubs and much more!
reviews.title: Oldie (literally )but a goddie..

reviews.text: If people want to see the dubai beaches and do aquatic things with their family this is the perfect hotel!
reviews.title: AMAZING HOTEL, always feel there in PARADISE

reviews.text: We spend one week and it was a great family vacations.
reviews.title: Best quality of service and exceptional place for family

reviews.text: All activities they have for the kids allowed us to spend some time as a couple too.
reviews.title: good but not great and small room

reviews.text: All staff was very attentive and is a place to come back
reviews.title: Food, food, food

reviews.text: Premium Leisure Club is the best difference. best variety of restaurants.
reviews.title: Dubai Magic

reviews.text: We were upgrade!
reviews.title: Another Great Holiday - only one moan!

reviews.text: the hotel is nice but can get VERY busy...if you re with kids then it s probably the best spot, in terms of kids pool, club , water park ect...but if you re planning on a romantic or peaceful holiday..in an elegant hotel...no way....forget it! there are plenty of better choices in dubai...
reviews.title: comfortable but that s all!

reviews.text: but with kids...then it s perfect!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Throughout. Booked to stay again the day after we returned..

reviews.text: breakfast is ok, plenty of choices but the quality can be better...
reviews.title: Sailing through Jumeirah

reviews.text: overall is a comfortable hotel in a great spot! but that s all!!!
reviews.title: It just can't get any better than this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the JBH in June 2011. It was our daughter's 4th Birthday so we booked up to make use of the access to Wild Wadi. From the moment we checked in we were treated exactly as one would expect from a 5* hotel. The staff were professional and friendly, from the receptionist to the cleaner in the hallway. With a choice of 20 or so places to eat and free access to what has to be the best water park in Dubai, we felt it was the perfect place to stay. The staff additionally (and unprompted) arranged Birthday cakes, balloons etc for our daughter , just based on a brief mention by her that it was her Birthday.
reviews.title: JBH - Going from strength to strength.....

reviews.text: I Autumn we went to Dubai for one week. This hotel is perfect, but very expensive. The service was brilliant, as we expected of a 5 star hotel. The sleep quality was good, but one night there was a beach festival which was a problem. The hotel was very clean, nearly spotless. The rooms were perfect, the bathroom was outstanding. The breakfast was good too, we were going to the Beachcombers restaurant. Also it is good that you have a free access to the Wild Wadi aqua park.
reviews.title: Very luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really warm welcome to the hotel 9the attendant who checked us is was very friendly)even though it was very late when we arrived and we were greeted with a refreshing drink. The breakfast buffet had a wonderful choice so it was hard to get bored with the variety. We could not fault it.
reviews.title: Awesome Breakfast

reviews.text: The beach was very clean. We stayed in an executive room with no balcony. The deco was all new and a quiet AC for a great night's sleep. The service was great except Gurpreet at the Rivoli shop whose attitude was awful and gave us incorrect information.
reviews.title: perfect in every way

reviews.text: Wow, what can I say. We came here as a 50th birthday treat for my husband. From start to finish it was perfect, service was top class, staff couldn't do enough to help but at no point were intrusive. You were left to enjoy your meal, but they knew exactly what was going on around them and were always there if needed. Food was fantastic, what a choice, from the breakfast buffet to the meals, really fantastic quality. The little touches were what made a difference, ie. coming round with ice lollies for the children, the staff at the pools were so friendly to the children too, playing ball with them etc. Also I have never seen so many lifeguards on duty anywhere, they really do take the safety of the children seriously, quite rightly so too. An error was made by our travel agent at home regarding our board basis, and the hotel even although it wasn't their fault, resolved the issue for us and couldn't do enough to help us. It was so appreciated as it wasn't their responsibility to sort it for us, but they were wonderful. Saving up to go back, it was just sheer luxury.
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of days in September on business. The hotel made the visit fantastic, the staff are superb and the overall quality is first rate. It is well worth all the reviews and would certainly come back on a family holiday. Once all the work is complete on site you really should choose this hotel for a visit.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Excellent views from the room, the staff at the hotel were amazing an fulfilled any need. The food was delicious. I recommend the food inside the hotel as there was billions to choose from. The pools were great with free ice lolllies and ice cold water spraying. The hotel is in a brilliant spot right on the beach an the hotel can arrange for you to go to various places like a desert safari which my family and I thoroughly enjoyed! Wild wadi was an absolute blast an great for the whole family. Definitely the best holiday I've ever and will ever go on in my whole life...!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: No holiday will top this!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly just to let you know I have been to Dubai many times and this is the best hotel I have stayed at. The service is excellent!! The staff are fantastic really nice and I am not just saying that.
reviews.title: Best Holiday And Hotel Ever !!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we were greated with a nice cold drink and a nice cold towel which was very welcoming. We were checked in straightaway and went straight up to our room. The room was very clean and there was plenty of water to drink which was great. The room was not one of the not one of the refurbished ones, but it was very clean and spacious. Enough for our needs.
reviews.title: Beyond fabulous!

reviews.text: The pools are great and the beach is lovely. The pool staff are very nice and no one is going to drown here. There are loads of lifeguards, but not in your face kind of way!! I got a sun bed for the pool from the shop at the hotel and one of the pool staff took it off me and came back five minutes later with it pumped up with air, so I was ready for action! Excellent service. There is a pool bar and you can get snacks and drinks all day if you wish. There are plenty of sun beds and fresh towels to lounge on. Also another nice touch is that they give out free ice lollies in the day which was very welcoming. When the lifeguard appears with the ice lollies all the holiday makers look like little fishes swimming to the side of the pool to get a lolly, really funny and nice. I too swam over to get a lolly many times !!!!! They also bring them to your sun beds.
reviews.title: Worth seeing, but do it on expenses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at this hotel is excellent, the portions are very big. I am sure a came back weighing a bit more, but it was worth it as we had a great time. I want to give a special mention to Tammie a Chef at the Beachcombers resturant. She is genuine person and cooked me a dish as I fancied a chicken dish. She did this with the goodness of her heart and wow was I touched. Also, a special mention to Orwell who worked at the Italian restuarant, what a nice man. Knew what drinks we liked. We often popped there for a night time cold drink and a chat. Really nice.
reviews.title: JBH, Beit Al Bahar upgrade! WOW! :-)

reviews.text: This was our 5th trip to the JBH and it couldn't have been better. We landed at 8.00am on the virgin flight and was sitting down and having breakfast by 8.55am I think that was the fastest time we have ever done it in. Our room was ready but when we looked at it we were not pleased as it smelt a little bit but that was no trouble the bell boy phoned and we were moved to a new room straight away.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: We were surprised to get our room as quick as we did as it was the Monday after half term that we arrived 27th may and as we walked around the exec pool we saw alot of old friends from the year before it was truly like coming home.
reviews.title: Jumeirah Beach or Atlantis?

reviews.text: This year we were invited to the cocktail party and it was nice to meet management face to face.
reviews.title: Luxury
Keeps getting better!
reviews.text: The premium leisure is open now and it is really nice. Albert greeted as again and well as the girls it was a shame Charles was on leave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to treat ourselves and for the last few days we moved and stayed in the Beit Al Bahar villas which were unbelievable just wish I could stay there every time from the butler to the plunge pool and afternoon tea served in your room everything was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect & romantic wedding anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's the little surprises like the complimentary lemon popsicles on the beach just when you think you can't take the heat any longer that make me love Jumeirah Beach Resort! The staff are all friendly and I feel that they are always on our side, wanting to help and make our stay more enjoyable anyway they can. It's genuine and quite rare, I must add to find such service. My only problem was the bed; mattress was way too soft. Everything else was beyond expectation! and it wasn't even my first visit!
reviews.title: Will go back for sure!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right from the start we felt that we are in a special place - we arrived late, bit tired so it was such a relief to be welcome with glass of most refreshing juice. We were escorted to our room - room with the view!!!! ...
reviews.title: Would expect more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff was great, helpful, friendly with a smile:-)
reviews.title: Spoilt by very noisy outside Music venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - the only darkish cloud on otherwise perfect sky. Long line of waiting guests, waiting to be crossed from the list (of those with breakfast) . I have to wait for almost 15 minutes before being escorted to my table. Perhaps should say that it was worth waiting...most extensive choices i ever come across!!!.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: When we arrived at 8am after a overnight flight we were shown to the executive lounge(which you pay for when you book an exec room) where you could have breakfast,tea,coffee etc as you can't get in your room until 2pm.
reviews.title: We loved it and we will come back :)))

reviews.text: Beautiful resort, friendly staff, great beach and pools, incredible fitness center, several different restaurants from which to choose and one of the best breakfast buffets I've ever experienced. Our room was a little dated but the hotel is undergoing a renovation of the rooms so be sure to ask for a updated room. We saw one and it was really nice. If you get an executive club-level room, you also get access to a lounge with food and drinks.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

reviews.text: Only flaw, and it was a small one, was the dinner meals were not as good as the breakfasts. I would recommend trying something off site if you want a true fine dining experience. If you are easy going, the food variety and theme settings of the restaurants still make for fun evenings.
reviews.title: Simple FANTASTIC !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had gone to this hotel for Lunch in Feb this year.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - I Can't Help Returning !
Fantastic hotel with great staff and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No words can describe the experience.esp the view from the topmost floor :)
reviews.title: It doesn't get much better

reviews.text: This was our 11th trip to Dubai and our 4th time back to JBH and it was a good as ever. We went in the October school holiday it was busy and nothing was too much trouble. We arrived early morning and after breakfast our room was ready which is a big plus. It was like coming home again with everyone remembering us by name. We booked as always the executive room and a special thanks to kavandra by the exec pool bar who alwayshad our drinks ready at lunch time but all the people b the pool were great.
reviews.title: Again another fantastic holiday

reviews.text: A big special thanks to Patrick who made sure everything went well on our holiday and nothing was too much trouble for him to sort out for us as it was my wife's birthday while we were away.
reviews.title: Fabulous as ever!

reviews.text: Also a big thanks to Charles and Albert who worked so hard in the premium lounge and sun deck.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, food, location and service

reviews.text: Cannot wait until we return next year
reviews.title: The Best Family Resort

reviews.text: following on from our successful trip last November, my mother and I once again visited Jumeirah Beach for 5 nights, and once again what a great 5 nights they were. The beach is delightful, the choice of restaurants non exhaustive and the staff smiling and polite. The gym is one of the best hotel gyms I have ever used, plus all the sporting facilities are fantastic for a sporty type like myself.
reviews.title: Nice enough, good facilities, but just dull Dubai

reviews.text: I usually love staying here but was sadly disappointed this time, rooms smell musty but to have that sorted for one of the newer rooms we were told that it would cost more!! I would have thought the hotel would sort rooms in that returning guests would be put in the new rooms to keep them returning?!?
reviews.title: Very disappointed with this stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Internet connection was up and down like a yoyo, we told to use the business centre instead which isn't always convenient when you are already in the grounds of the hotel where there is usually a wifi signal. We were just fobbed off and told it was because of the refurbishments.
reviews.title: Excelent service at Jumeirah Beach Hotel at Villa 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Certain Bars and restaurants were closed without us being informed, one of the days was a 'dry day' due to the Islamic new year but again we weren't told this at the time of booking neither was it advertised on the website.
reviews.title: Right on beach with free water park access and great gym

reviews.text: I found prices had increased quite substantially since our last visit.
reviews.title: very good but impersonal

reviews.text: Was also disappointed with the breakfast quality this stay.
reviews.title: hotel is excellent

reviews.text: This was are first stay at JBH we have always stayed at the DAM and we were staying 14 nghts.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to go back

reviews.text: My husband was unsure if he wanted to go to the JBH but after 1 day he was in love with the place. We were on the 16th floor in an exec room and it was worth every penny, we ate breakfast in prem lounge and our eggs were being cooked before we had even sat down.
reviews.title: For the money paid, not worth it

reviews.text: The staff there are lovely and new everyone by name we also had afternoon tea every day which was nice to just get out of the sun for a while.
reviews.title: A great stay again

reviews.text: We used the exec pool everyday just because to was nice a quite there and our towels were there for us everyday though we were up early everyday.
reviews.title: Great, friendly service, always with a smile.

reviews.text: Our daughter was never up until lunchtime but ordered breakfast to our room everyday.
reviews.title: Perfect family hotel - can't wait to return even if we leave the kids at home

reviews.text: I have to say I was totally Impressed with the Jumeriah Beach Hotel t the staff can don't do enough for you.. They were so friendly cared and helpful. Throughout the day pool or beach they would bring refreshments of fruit and ice lollies. The breakfast buffet was out of this world they had everything you could possibly think of breakfast it was endless also the restaurants were fantastic and I couldn't believe how amazing they prepared and the quality was on another level fantastic restaurants... The service was fantastic the rooms were cleaned every day immaculately and everything was always clean and tidy.. I can't wait to go back it was an amazing holiday to say the least
reviews.title: Amazing hotel everything about it was perfect

reviews.text: Amazing hotel, Stayed with my husband and two children 7 and 4, We only stayed a week which is not long enough...... We had a wonderful time, the staff cant do enough for you, I am a worrier with the kids they could not be in a safer place they are life guards everywhere, around the kids pool there is 3-4 at all times, the kids club as excellent again so many staff for the children, a very organised too... My two loved the kids club they couldnt wait to go there every day... The food was amazing, everything about this hotel was great, The only negative i would say would be the price of drinks, i think £15 for 3 apple juices is a little excessive... If your going to dubai wit hchildren 4 and above check out kidzania in the dubai mall its a must for children....
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from another amazing holiday at the JBH, the Jumeirah group cannot be faulted for there attention to detail in everyway which then adds to your holiday experience. We to advantage of half-board this year which was great and we were able to eat at various resturants at JBH and at various other hotels owned by Jumeirah. We had one small incident with some night-wear but is was soon resolved. The improvements being made to the hotel are fantastic, the new Premium Leisure Club is fantastic, as is the Club Executive lounge.
reviews.title: "Another Memorable Stay in this Amazing Hotel"

reviews.text: Staff we would like to mention for exceptional service which made our time here fabulous and truly deserve to be acknowledged are....at the Executive Pool, Earl the manager who we met this year for the 1st time whose charisma and professonalism is second to none. Nishrantha his deputy manager, Younnos who always goes the xtra mile to help you with everything and in our opinion deserves promotion as does Sanjeefe, Khavindra who always made time to talk to us, we wish him and his wife all the luck with there new baby due soon, and lastly Johnson, a new face to us but im sure will go far....All the staff in the Premium Leisure Club especially ALBERT whose amazing memory for guests needs nerver fails to amaze us, he epitomizes everything Jumeirah Beach Hotel with his attention to detail. Our favourate resturants La Veranda, all the staff here work so hard and for this we thank you all. Lastly Patrick Fernandez the outside resturants manager who made the time to speak to so many guests everyday to gain feedback and improve where neccessary. Anyone that has ever stayed at JBH more than once will agree with us when we say its like "going home" as the service you get is so genuine and friendly and nothing is too much trouble for ANY member of staff.
reviews.title: Beach club is not worth the money

reviews.text: We cannot wait to return next year. Thanks to everyone....
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply a great hotel whether for family with kids or couples taking a romantic holiday. The rooms are spacious, full access to a nice beach, great food. You can spend the evening until midnight in the nearby Jumaira canal shopping mall and bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Superb service
Amazing place
reviews.text: Travelled with husband and 14 year old. After arriving late at night we were put in a room on the third floor, lovely room but had requested a high floor, as it was late we waited till the next morning and asked to be moved. Fantastic room on 13th floor with amazing views of burj Arab which you never get fed up with.

Breakfast was great especially in the beachcomber bar on the beach, much quieter than latitude. We ate at latitude twice which was ok preferred Mexican night to English night. We ate at carnvale which was my favourite meal and also tried the Thai at the beachcombers and the la veranda. The Thai had loads of prawns and lobster and had a great atmosphere with live music.
reviews.title: Still in a league of its own. Excellent

reviews.text: Pool beds only hard to get on the Friday and Saturday which is their weekend so lots of locals visiting and the hotel was a lot busier. You can help yourself to as many clean beach towels as you want and they come round with free lollies throughout the day. Lovely beach area with plenty of beds. Sea amazing.
reviews.title: Best hotel ever... ill stay here again

reviews.text: Cleaners excellent cant do enough for you. Leaving chocolates and towel art. Clean bedding and towels every day.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I was there at least 15 times , my elder child was growing there . it is perfect for kids unlikely all others hotels of jumeirah chain. I decided to make the review this time because hotel have now many renovated room and so one of the mane disadvantage has disappeared . I saw many 5 star hotel in Dubai ( Atlantis , Rits - Carlton , Le Meridien and other ) believe - for child's it is the best .
reviews.title: Absolutelly perfect for rest with child's in spring and November - December

reviews.text: My recommendation to take premium leisure club , not only because of food and drink , mainly due to executive swimming pool.
reviews.title: Paradise View but Expensive Drinks

reviews.text: I have been to JBT Hotel this August. There are very few tourists in Summer in Dubai and we decided to have a calm family trip. We succeeded, Dubai is wonderful this time if you can afford the HEATTTT. JBT Has really beautiful view when you choose rooms with no balcony. balcony is useless and makes room little and closes the half of the really paradise view! strongly recommend to ask for room with no balcony and higher floors.
reviews.title: great location, some imperfections

reviews.text: Worst thing about this hotel is the drinks that are extra charge. water, tea, milk - everything that is liquid!!!! but food is delicious. eat soups and dont drink liquid:)
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: its a very nice hotel with great view, spacious rooms and very kid-friendly but some imperfections. we had an issue with the wifi in our room. we could connect wifi better at the end of the beach than inside the room! the beach itself is not so great as it feels a little enclosed (in comparison to the beach next door at mina al salam) we also had an incident at the beach where my husband left his shirt and shoes and some toys for my kid on the lounging chair and went up to the pool , only to come back and not find his chair or his clothes until a gentleman staying at the hotel told us that he saw one of the staff actually throwing our stuff on the side of a service kiosk near the trash can!! they did apologize for that but not much was done to compensate! The food was good as my husband had a great breakfast experience, but then poolside, we were charged 150 AED for half a watermelon, which is like 50$$$, most expensive watermelon ive ever eaten!! i did have a great massage at the beach which i absolutely loved, however the indoor spa itself is not too impressive.
reviews.title: The best family beach hotel anywhere...

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here 10 years ago for our honeymoon and decided to return for our anniversary with our two girls. The place is as amazing as it was a decade ago in fact I would say it is actually better.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel in an amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shared a room with our two girls so we had a sofa bed and an extra single bed put in the room, we kept these up all week and there was still plenty of space. The view of the Burj Al Arab hotel opposite was amazing and a sight to wake up to everyday.
reviews.title: best hotel on the beach

reviews.text: Food - We generally had a late breakfast in Latitude and skipped lunch as the kids wanted to spend all day swimming. The choice in Latitude which is an international buffet style restaurant is amazing with 3 rooms serving breakfast choices from every corner of the globe. The same can be said for lunch and dinner which follow the same theme.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, especially for kids!

reviews.text: The best restaurant we ate in was La Parilla which is an Argentinian restaurant on the 25th floor. The food was top notch and the ambience was great with a live south American band and Latino dancers. We enjoyed it so much that we went twice.
reviews.title: 27th time at jumeirah!!!!!

reviews.text: I must mention here that all of the restaurants we ate in including the fine dining one's were very accommodating to our two girls who are aged 7 & 8 and they all had childrens menu's.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: try latitute very beautiful restaurant and also bars and caffes. Visit also wild-vadi wonderfull experiance.
reviews.title: the best hotel,service ever!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel 6 times, and it was just perfect in all ways shapes and forms.
reviews.title: great hotel to return to

reviews.text: Service, food and all that goes with it was great. yes, perhaps the price is higher than other hotels, but it is worth it!
reviews.title: Plenty of positives about the JBH, just not the front desk

reviews.text: We were here as a couple, with 1 other couple, and also with a family of 10. Each and every time our wishes were all met.
reviews.title: JBH delivers in style

reviews.text: There is a huge assortment of restaurants and bars, and it is ideal to be able to visit all of the other Jumeirah hotels on the beach and be able to book all things to your room in the Beach Hotel
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: This has to be the most beautiful, well run, friendly and cleanest hotel I could ever hope to stay in. From the gorgeous decor in the (enormous) rooms, views to die for, gondola boat rides through the resort, 40+ restaurants to choose from in the hotel plus sea turtle rehabilitation... I can't say enough about it! Reading the other reviews; I am in shock there were any low rating - the staff went above and beyond any request, and we even joked when we requested ice one evening they hadn't arrived within their usual 30 seconds. I can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: The most AMAZING hotel I've ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic. The level of service is amazing and has not lost that personal touch despite its size, which makes it even more impressive. We stayed in an executive room which gives access to the executive lounge and executive pool. The staff in the executive lounge are very professional but extremely personable and know you by name. Nothing is too much trouble for them. There is an amazing range of restaurants and you can also eat at the other Jumeirah Group hotels (Al Qasr and Minr Al salam) which are easily reached via beach buggy which is free of charge and always available. We never waited more than a minute or so for one.
reviews.title: Excellent service well worth a visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is undergoing a total refurbishment at the moment but it does not disrupt your stay, they have been very clever and closed one side of the hotel. We had a sneak preview of the new exec rooms - they are very swish and high tech.
reviews.title: World class hotel at a World class location

reviews.text: Located directly across the bay from the "6 stars" Burj Al Arab hotel, Jumeirah Beach Hotel is situated in a perfect part of Dubai. Away from the busy centre, but yet only an easy and short taxi ride from everything. The hotel has great view of the bay and the Burj Al Arab, as well as acess to some of the most beautiful private beaches.
reviews.title: Impressive Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel belongs to a huge hotel complex along beach side, which means you have access to a wide variety of facilities, such as restaurants, shopping malls and a large number of swimming pools. Getting around inside the complex is made easy (especially in the searing heat) by the private golf buggies transport. They can be ordered at phone locations all around the complex or simply "flagged down" as they go past. All the buggies drivers were friendly and knowleable, we had a great tour of the whole complex by one driver, and were taken to some of the greatest locations for photographs by another.
reviews.title: Looking forward to our second trip June 2012

reviews.text: We have just come back from another fantastic stay at the JBH, we stayed through a very busy time during the school holidays. We were picked up from the airport and checked in at the executive lounge and we were told we had one of the new rooms and that our room was ready which was a plus as it was only 9.00 am.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The new rooms are lovely and buttons for everything my husband loved waking us up in the morning by opening the curtains by the button beside his bed. Bathrooms are a good size with a double sink, big shower and bath. The sitting area has a bed which was a good size and was folded back during the day.
reviews.title: La parrilla: Great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we were there the premium lounge was shut as they are extending it downstairs and moving the bar upstairs and was moved to the 1st floor at the other end of the building, the only bad thing I can say was that it was really busy and no extra staff. But the service was second to none as always a special thank you to Albert and Charles and the girls whose names I cannot remember who went that extra bit to make sure our stay was special. Also the staff in executive bar Thomas and co who still remembered our drinks for our last visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort!!!

reviews.text: Also a special thanks to the staff at the pool bar and pool who are always there to help even when it was 46 one day.
reviews.title: Hotel ok but service at Mahiki restaurant AWFUL

reviews.text: My husband also asked where the bar stools had gone one night in the executive bar and was told they had been taken down to the premium lounge as they were needed down there but he liked sitting there while me and our daughter got ready at night but Firas Sharrouf the front office manager next night had one back at the bar for him. That is the best thing about JBH nothing is too much trouble and that is why we will be back again hopefully in October.
reviews.title: Amazing

description: Jumeirah Beach Hotel is located directly at the Arabian shores. All rooms and suites feature seaview, the latest technology and free wireless internet.Guests receive unlimited complimentary access to Wild Wadi Waterpark and Sinbad's Kids Club. The Pavilion Sports Club with its tennis courts, watersports, gym, PADI dive centre, climbing wall and Spa offers a gregarious experience. 5 sensual signature restaurants, a casual dining selection and 3 stylish bars are renowned for genuine, true hospitality.
